DataElement.preferredDefinition: A concept or idea not associated with any specific instance.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity. (NCI):A condition or state at a particular time._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._A condition or state at a particular time._Text; the words of something written._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._A condition or state at a particular time._Text; the words of something written._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: The novel recognition of the presence of a disease, condition, or injury based on investigation, analysis or tests for signs and symptoms.
Occurring before a therapeutic procedure.
Occurring after a therapeutic procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring during or associated with a surgical procedure.

Concepts.definition: Occurring during or associated with a surgical procedure.
Relating to or occurring during the period immediately following a surgical operation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).

Concepts.definition: An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Recurrence of symptoms of a disease at the original site.

Concepts.definition: Recurrence of symptoms of a disease at the original site.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Recurrence of symptoms of a disease, at a site different and away from the original site.

Concepts.definition: Recurrence of symptoms of a disease, at a site different and away from the original site.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

Concepts.definition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately before a surgical operation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.: The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not provided or available.: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

Concepts.definition: Not provided or available.
The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

PermissibleValues.value: Biopsy proven residual disease at least 8 weeks after completing metastatic site radiation
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Biopsied residual disease at least 8 weeks post radiation therapy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Biopsied residual disease at least 8 weeks post radiation therapy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.: Cancer cells that remain after attempts to remove the cancer have been made.: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.: A natural number greater than 7 and less than 9 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of seven and one.: Any period of seven consecutive days.: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
Tumor cells that remain in the body following cancer treatment.

A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than 7 and less than 9 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of seven and one.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

PermissibleValues.value: Positive bone marrow at end of Consolidation
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Positive bone marrow following consolidation therapy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Positive bone marrow following consolidation therapy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.: Treatment that is given after cancer has disappeared following the initial therapy. Consolidation therapy is used to kill any cancer cells that may be left in the body. It may include radiation therapy, a stem cell transplant, or treatment with drugs that kill cancer cells.

Concepts.definition: A finding of abnormality following an examination or observation confirming something, such as the presence of a disease, condition, or microorganism.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Treatment that is given after initial therapy to kill any remaining cancer cells.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Progressive or recurrent disease at metastatic site

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Progressive or recurrent disease at metastatic site
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.: The return of a disease after a period of remission.: A tumor arising at a location distant to the primary lesion.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.
A tumor arising at a location distant to the primary lesion.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Progressive or recurrent disease at primary site

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Progressive or recurrent disease at primary site
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.: Recurrence of symptoms of a disease at the original site.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
Recurrence of symptoms of a disease at the original site.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: The words of something written.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
